IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: SHENANDOAH NATIONAL PARK TRUST SUPPORTS THE SHENANDOAH NATIONAL PARK THROUGH ADVOCACY AND BY RAISING FUNDS THAT PROTECT SHENANDOAH'S MAGNIFICENT NATURAL AND HISTORIC RESOURCES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE SHENANDOAH NATIONAL PARK TRUST IS THE OFFICIAL PHILANTHROPIC PARTNER OF SHENANDOAH NATIONAL PARK. THE TRUST RAISES FUNDS TO SUPPORT INITIATIVES THAT BENEFIT SHENANDOAH NATIONAL PARK TODAY AND FOR FUTURE GENERATIONS.
IRS990.Desc: AS AN OFFICIAL PHILANTHROPIC PARTNER OF THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE, THE SHENANDOAH NATIONAL PARK TRUST RAISES FUNDS TO SUPPORT SHENANDOAH NATIONAL PARK'S MISSION TO PROTECT ITS NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES, CONNECT PEOPLE TO THEIR NATIONAL PARK, EDUCATE AND INSPIRE THE NEXT GENERATION OF PARK STEWARDS, AND ENSURE A STRONG PARK SERVICE WORKFORCE. FUNDS RAISED SUPPORT PROGRAMS IN CLIMATE CHANGE RESILIENCE, HISTORIC PRESERVATION, SCIENTIFIC EXPLORATION, YOUTH EDUCATION, AND RECREATION.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE TRUST SUPPORTS THE BLUE RIDGE PRISM (PARTNERSHIP FOR REGIONAL INVASIVE SPECIES MANAGEMENT), A COLLABORATIVE PUBLIC-PRIVATE INITIATIVE TO CONTROL INVASIVE, NON-NATIVE SPECIES IN SHENANDOAH NATIONAL PARK, AND 2.5 MILLION ACRES OF SURROUNDING HABITAT.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART II, LINE 10, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE TRUST HAS REVIEWED AND EVALUATED THE RELEVANT TECHNICAL MERITS OF EACH OF ITS TAX POSITIONS IN ACCORDANCE WITH GUIDANCE ESTABLISHED BY THE FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS BOARD (FASB) AND DETERMINED THAT THERE ARE NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT WOULD HAVE A MATERIAL IMPACT ON THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS OF THE TRUST.
REVENUES NETTED AGAINST EXPENSES ON FINANCIALS 159,265.
REVENUES NETTED AGAINST EXPENSES ON FINANCIALS 159,265.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: CO-SPONSOR FOR FUNDRAISER - PASSTHROUGH OF ITS PORTION OF NET INCOME.
CO-SPONSOR FOR FUNDRAISER - PASSTHROUGH OF ITS PORTION OF NET INCOME.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2: SHENANDOAH NATIONAL PARK TRUST AWARDS GRANTS TO FUND PROJECTS AND PROGRAMS BENEFITTING SHENANDOAH NATIONAL PARK.
THE TRUST REPORTS THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS RATHER THAN THE NUMBER OF ITEMS RECEIVED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: RETURN WILL BE AVAILABLE FOR ALL BOARD MEMEBERS TO REVIEW AND SUBMIT CONCERNS PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR MONITORS FOR POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST, AND THE POLICY IS CURRENTLY ISSUED TO TRUSTEES FOR RENEWALS ON AN ANNUAL BASIS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 18
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE TRUST'S FORM 990 AND FORM 1023 ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TRUST GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST AT THE DISCRETION OF THE ORGANIZATION.
PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM PRIOR YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART XI, LINE 9, CHANGES IN NET ASSETS:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A TOTAL OF $281,074 OF COSTS INCURRED DURING PLANNING AND CONSTRUCTION OF A CAPITAL ASSET WERE WRITTEN-OFF. THIS PROJECT IS NO LONGER A PRIORITY FOR THE SHENANDOAH NATIONAL PARK OR THE SHENANDOAH NATIONAL PARK TRUST AND THEREFORE WILL NOT PROCEED.
